page.title: 20Changes in Harvesting
page.content:
Methods of harvesting both hay and corn have changed dramatically over the last 25 years.A binder was used to cut the corn and tie it into sheaves. These were left in the field to dry. The corn was stored in large ricks thatched with straw.Later a threshing machine came and separated the ears of corn from the stalk.All this took many weeks and now a combine harvester can do it all in a few days.
All the information on these pages was compiled by the children of Class 2 of Weare School in July 1985 with help from many adults and other children.
